definition: name (of a person or thing)/CL:個|个[ge4]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Use a pen to write your name.
sentences.chinese: 用原子笔写下你的名字。

sentences.english: A cultural icon, he is widely known by the single name Elvis.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个文化符号，他的名字埃尔维斯也广为人知。

sentences.english: NorthStar, the first name in heavy-duty encoders, has the solution.
sentences.chinese: 北极星，在重型编码器的名字，有解决方案。

sentences.english: Cats and snakes are traditionally cooked together (in the south only), given the name "dragon tiger fight".
sentences.chinese: 猫和蛇通常一起做，名字叫“龙虎斗”。

sentences.english: And the fourth one is currently called Into the Wild Green Yonder.
sentences.chinese: 第四部电影的名字暂定为《荒野绿林的彼端》。

sentences.english: Mr Qin is our history teacher. He has a wonderful name Qin Han.
sentences.chinese: 秦先生是我们的历史老师，他有一个好听的名字秦汉。

sentences.english: "What are those good-smelling flowers with thorns called again?" he eventually asks.
sentences.chinese: 那种好闻又带刺的花儿叫什么名字来着？

sentences.english: Sure enough, I found her name in the phone book.
sentences.chinese: 果真，我在电话簿上找到了她的名字。

sentences.english: He did not give their names.
sentences.chinese: 但他没有透露他们的名字。

sentences.english: The synthetic element nobelium was named after him.
sentences.chinese: 人造元素锘是他的名字命名的。

sentences.english: And what are some of the names you've given your little front-seat driver?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个小东西取了什么名字？

sentences.english: My name is Evert , and I come from Holland.
sentences.chinese: 我的名字叫艾福特，来自荷兰。

definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to be called/to be known as
to name/to be named/to christen/to seek fame
to name/to christen/to take a name
